title: How to Make Chai Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 160ºC.
steps.description: If fan force, preheat to 140ºC only. Prepare the baking trays (sheets) by lining with baking paper.

steps.headline: Beat the butter and icing sugar until creamy.
steps.description: Use an electric mixer if wished.

steps.headline: Sift the flours and spices into a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Mix together to form a soft dough. Remove the cookie dough onto a clean work surface and knead it for 5 minutes. Once smooth, stop kneading.

steps.headline: Lay down a sheet of baking paper.
steps.description: Place the dough on it and another sheet over the top. Roll the dough out over the top sheet of paper. Aim for about a 1 centimeter (0.4 in) thickness of dough.

steps.headline: Cut the round cookie shape.
steps.description: Use the end of a glass or a circle cookie cutter.

steps.headline: Arrange the cookie rounds on the baking trays.
steps.description: Brush with the milk to form a glaze when cooking. Sprinkle each cookie with a little white sugar to complete.

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for 15 minutes or until a golden colour.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven and leave to cool on the trays for 15 minutes.
steps.description: Remove from the trays onto a wire cooling rack to cool completely.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Once cooled, the cookies are ready to serve with a cup of chai. If storing, place in an airtight container and eat within a few days of baking.

text: Preheat the oven to 160ºC. If fan force, preheat to 140ºC only. Prepare the baking trays (sheets) by lining with baking paper. Beat the butter and icing sugar until creamy. Use an electric mixer if wished. Sift the flours and spices into a mixing bowl. Mix together to form a soft dough. Remove the cookie dough onto a clean work surface and knead it for 5 minutes. Once smooth, stop kneading. Lay down a sheet of baking paper. Place the dough on it and another sheet over the top. Roll the dough out over the top sheet of paper. Aim for about a 1 centimeter (0.4 in) thickness of dough. Cut the round cookie shape. Use the end of a glass or a circle cookie cutter. Arrange the cookie rounds on the baking trays. Brush with the milk to form a glaze when cooking. Sprinkle each cookie with a little white sugar to complete. Place in the oven. Bake for 15 minutes or until a golden colour. Remove from the oven and leave to cool on the trays for 15 minutes. Remove from the trays onto a wire cooling rack to cool completely. Serve. Once cooled, the cookies are ready to serve with a cup of chai. If storing, place in an airtight container and eat within a few days of baking.
